archimate:Node.name: Security Services
archimate:Node.documentation:
Security Services
• Next-Gen Firewalls
o Function: Advanced traffic filtering and inspection o Relationships:  Protects → Core Network, WAN Connections  Controls → Internet Gateway: For external traffic filtering  Integrates with → IDS/IPS: For comprehensive threat protection  Reports to → SIEM: For security event correlation
• Load Balancers
o Function: Distributes traffic across multiple servers for performance and reliability o Relationships:  Serves → EHR, Critical Applications: For high availability  Connected to → Core Network: For traffic distribution  Performs → Health Monitoring: For automatic failover
• VPN Services
o Function: Secure encrypted tunnels for remote access o Relationships:  Secures → Remote Access: For staff working remotely  Authenticates via → Identity Management: For user verification  Monitored by → SIEM: For security events
• Identity Management
o Function: Manages user identities, authentication, authorization o Relationships:  Provides → Authentication Services: For all systems and applications  Integrates with → Access Control: For permission enforcement  Enforces → Multi-Factor Authentication: For sensitive systems  Syncs with → HR Systems: For employment status verification
• Access Control
o Function: Enforces authorization policies across systems o Relationships:  Controls access to → All Applications and Systems  Implements → Role-Based Access Control: For principle of least privilege  Integrates with → Identity Management: For authentication verification  Audited by → SIEM: For compliance monitoring
• Data Encryption
o Function: Protects data confidentiality o Relationships:  Protects → Patient Data, Financial Data  Implemented for → Data at Rest, Data in Transit  Required for → HIPAA Compliance  Managed via → Key Management System
• Endpoint Protection
o Function: Secures end-user devices against threats o Relationships:  Protects → Clinical Workstations, Mobile Devices  Reports to → SIEM: For threat intelligence  Managed via → Centralized Management Console
• Security Information & Event Management (SIEM)
o Function: Centralizes security monitoring, analysis, and alerting o Relationships:  Monitors → All Network Infrastructure: For security events  Monitors → Security Services: For comprehensive visibility  Integrates with → Incident Response Procedures: For rapid response  Provides → Compliance Reporting: For regulatory requirements
• Network Access Control (NAC)
o Function: Controls device access to network resources o Relationships:  Enforces → Access Layer Security: At the connection point  Monitors → Wireless Networks: For unauthorized devices  Integrates with → Endpoint Protection: For compliance checking  Reports to → SIEM: For security visibility
• Intrusion Detection System (IDS)
o Function: Monitors network traffic for suspicious activity o Relationships:  Monitors → Core Network: For threat detection  Reports to → SIEM: For alert correlation  Works with → IPS: For comprehensive protection
• Intrusion Prevention System (IPS)
o Function: Actively blocks detected threats o Relationships:  Protects → Core Network: From known attacks  Integrates with → Firewalls: For defense in depth  Reports to → SIEM: For security event logging
• Data Loss Prevention (DLP)
o Function: Prevents unauthorized data exfiltration o Relationships:  Monitors → Network Traffic: For sensitive data patterns  Protects → Protected Health Information, Financial Data  Enforces → Data handling policies  Reports to → SIEM: For compliance monitoring
